title: Manchester United transfer news: Gary Neville and Roy Keane disagree over Christian Eriksen move
text:
Christian Eriksen was desperate to leave Tottenham last summer (Picture: Getty)

Manchester United legends Roy Keane and Gary Neville disagree over the club’s interest in Tottenham star Christian Eriksen.

Metro.co.uk revealed in October that Ole Gunnar Solskjaer is keen on signing the Denmark international and the board are ready to fund a move in the January transfer window.

Eriksen was desperate to leave Spurs last summer but a dream move to Real Madrid failed to materialise and he’s cut a sullen figure ever since.

The Dane has been one of Spurs’ star players during Mauricio Pochettino’s era but Keane does not agree with Neville that United should sign the midfielder.

Neville backs Solskjaer’s move for Eriksen (Picture: Sky Sports)

Asked if the top clubs will be lining up to sign Eriksen, Neville replied: ‘Yes, absolutely.

‘Yeah, they’d take him tomorrow. I think he would [improve United].

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘What you’re seeing at the moment with Eriksen is a player who is not buying into what’s happened. He’s disinterested.

‘He’ll just switch it back on again when he goes to another club.

‘Will Manchester United take him? Will PSG take him? Will Juventus take him? free? Yes, they will, for free, they will.’

Keane does not believe Eriksen would improve United’s side (Picture: Sky Sports)

It was at this point that Keane made his views clear and said Eriksen would not represent an improvement on what United have.

‘Not if I were the Manchester United manager,’ said Keane.

‘I think he will get a move, he’s on a free.

‘But I don’t think he’d improve those teams and that’s the key for a club like Manchester United who are trying to close the gap.

‘He won’t make Man United better, but having said that, Man United bought Fred.’

The pair were speaking after Tottenham’s 2-1 defeat to Liverpool at Anfield.

Eriksen started the game after missing the midweek win against Red Star Belgrade but goals from Mohamed Salah and Jordan Henderson gave the Reds victory after Harry Kane’s opener.
